senses.de: To continue at the same speed or level as another person or thing.
senses.ex: You'll have to run faster if you want to keep up with me.

Tips.title: Competitive Context
Tips.description: Used in situations involving competition or comparison in progress and speed.
Tips.example: She's training hard to keep up with the other athletes.

Tips.title: Group Activities
Tips.description: Often used when someone tries to match the pace or level of a group.
Tips.example: During the tour, try to keep up with the guide and the rest of the group.

Tips.title: Not Literal
Tips.description: Can be used metaphorically, not just for physical speed.
Tips.example: You need to keep up with the class if you miss a lecture.

senses.de: To continue to learn or understand the latest news, fashion, etc.
senses.ex: I find it hard to keep up with the latest technology.

Tips.title: Rapid Change
Tips.description: Implies difficulty in staying updated due to frequent changes or developments.
Tips.example: Keeping up with fashion can be a challenge as the trends change every season.

Tips.title: Personal Effort
Tips.description: Reflects an individual's effort to stay current or knowledgeable.
Tips.example: He spends an hour each morning reading articles to keep up with industry news.

Tips.title: Not Always Physical
Tips.description: Also refers to intellectual or cultural matters, not just physical items.
Tips.example: To keep up with the debate, I had to familiarize myself with the latest research.

senses.de: To continue to do something at the same, usually high, level.
senses.ex: She finds it hard to keep up with her homework.

Tips.title: Achievement Maintenance
Tips.description: Infers maintaining a high standard of performance or work consistently.
Tips.example: Despite his busy schedule, he's kept up with his commitment to volunteer weekly.

Tips.title: Constant Commitment
Tips.description: Indicates a continuous effort, even when it's challenging to do so.
Tips.example: She has to keep up with her studies while also working part-time.
